question:
How many grams of hydrogen gas will be liberated when 6g of magnesium ribbon dissolves in 500cm3of 6M HCl?


(Mg=24, H=1, Cl=35.5)
explanation:
Mg + 2HCl → MgCl2+ H2
6 molar contains 6 Χ 36.5 gms 1000 cc

Solution i.e 6 Χ 36.5/2gms in 500 cc
= 3 Χ 36.5
24 gms of mg will react with 2 Χ 36.5 HCl to liberate 2 gm of hydrogen
∴ 6 gms will liberate 6 Χ 2/24 Χ 1 = 0.5 gm of H2

20 cm3 of 1 M H\(_2\)SO\(_4\) is mixed 20 cm\(^3\) of 1 M NaOH. The resulting solution is?
explanation:
The balanced equation for the reaction is:

\(2NaOH + H_2 SO_4 \to Na_2 SO_4 + 2H_2 O\)

\(\therefore 1M H_2 SO_4 \to 2M NaOH\)

\(1M NaOH \to 0.5M H_2 SO_4\)

options: acidic with a molarity of 0.50 M H<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub>
acidic with a molarity of 0.25 H<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub>
alkaline with a molarity of 0.25 M NaOH
